data.title: Birthplace of Madison Historical Highway Marker; Port Conway, Virginia
data.meta_description: This Virginia Historic Landmarks Commission highway marker EP-8 (dated 1971) is located on Highway 301 (James Madison Parkway) just north of the Rappahannock River in King George County in front of Emmanuel Episcopal Church. It was created by the Virginia Historic Landmarks Commission in 1971. The marker is titles: BIRTHPLACE OF MADISON The marker states the following: "At this place. Port Conway, James Madison, Fourth President of the United States and Father of the Constitution, was born, March 16, 1751. His mother was staying at her paternal home, Belle Grove 400 yards east when her son was born. Madison's father, James Madison, Senior, Lived in Orange County. The President had his home at Montpelier in that county." Courtesy of Dwayne and Maryanne Moyers, Realtors in Caroline County, King George County, Spotsylvania County, Fredericksburg, and Stafford County. Visit us at www.TheMoyersTeam.com
data.text:
This Virginia Historic Landmarks Commission highway marker EP-8 (dated 1971) is located on Highway 301 (James Madison Parkway) just north of the Rappahannock River in King George County in front of Emmanuel Episcopal Church. It was created by the Virginia Historic Landmarks Commission in 1971. The marker is titles: BIRTHPLACE OF MADISON The marker states the following: "At this place. Port Conway, James Madison, Fourth President of the United States and Father of the Constitution, was born, March 16, 1751. His mother was staying at her paternal home, Belle Grove 400 yards east when her son was born. Madison's father, James Madison, Senior, Lived in Orange County. The President had his home at Montpelier in that county."

Courtesy of Dwayne and Maryanne Moyers, Realtors in Caroline County, King George County, Spotsylvania County, Fredericksburg, and Stafford County. Visit us at www.TheMoyersTeam.com
